CN.content:
Please identify the "Material Name" entities in the following paragraph.

Paragraph: The photovoltaic properties of the three copolymers PDTP-BT , PDTP - DTBT and PDTP-DT2BT were studied by fabricating bulk heterojunction BHJ - type PSCs with a conventional sandwich configuration of ITO / PEDOT : PSS / polymer : PC 70 BM / Ca / Al.

Let's think step by step.

1. ITO: Indium Tin Oxide
2. PEDOT : PSS: Poly(3,4-ethylenedioxythiophene):poly(styrenesulfonate)
3. Polymer: PDTP-BT, PDTP-DTBT, PDTP-DT2BT (copolymers PDTP-BT, PDTP-DTBT, and PDTP-DT2BT are material names)
4. PC 70 BM: [6,6]-Phenyl-C61-butyric acid methyl ester (or PCBM)
5. Ca: Calcium
6. Al: Aluminum.

So, the material names in the paragraph are PDTP-BT, PDTP-DTBT, PDTP-DT2BT, and PCBM.
Please remove irrelevant entities and only keep the entities that clearly refer to Material Name.

The photovoltaic properties of the copolymers PDTP-BT, PDTP-DTBT, and PDTP-DT2BT were studied by fabricating bulk heterojunction BHJ - type PSCs with a conventional sandwich configuration of ITO / PEDOT : PSS / polymer (PDTP-BT, PDTP-DTBT, or PDTP-DT2BT) / PC 70 BM / Ca / Al.

So, the material names in the paragraph are PDTP-BT, PDTP-DTBT, PDTP-DT2BT, and PCBM.

Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Material Name".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

| Material Name |
| --- |
| PDTP-BT |
| PDTP-DTBT |
| PDTP-DT2BT |
| PC 70 BM |

So, the material names in the paragraph are PDTP-BT, PDTP-DTBT, PDTP-DT2BT, and PCBM.

PN.content:
Please identify the "Property Name" entities in the following paragraph.

Paragraph: The photovoltaic properties of the three copolymers PDTP-BT , PDTP - DTBT and PDTP-DT2BT were studied by fabricating bulk heterojunction BHJ - type PSCs with a conventional sandwich configuration of ITO / PEDOT : PSS / polymer : PC 70 BM / Ca / Al.

Let's think step by step.

1. PDTP-BT, PDTP-DTBT, PDTP-DT2BT: These are the names of the copolymers. In the context of materials science and polymer science, "copolymers" are a type of polymer where at least two different types of monomers are used in their synthesis. Therefore, these entities can be considered as "Property Name" entities representing specific types of copolymers with certain photovoltaic properties.

2. PSCs: This stands for "Perovskite Solar Cells." It is a type of solar cell that uses a perovskite-structured compound as the light-harvesting active layer. Therefore, "PSCs" can be considered as a "Property Name" entity representing a specific type of solar cell.

3. ITO: Indium Tin Oxide is a type of conductive oxide material commonly used as a transparent electrode in optoelectronic devices such as solar cells and flat-panel displays. Therefore, "ITO" can be considered as a "Property Name" entity representing a specific type of conductive material.

4. PEDOT : PSS: Poly(3,4-ethylenedioxythiophene):poly(styrenesulfonate) is a conducting polymer that is widely used as a hole transport layer in organic photovoltaic cells. Therefore, "PEDOT : PSS" can be considered as a "Property Name" entity representing a specific type of conducting polymer.

5. Polymer : PC 70 BM: This entity likely refers to a specific type of polymer: fullerene derivative [6,6]-phenyl-C61-butyric acid methyl ester (PC60BM or PC70BM). Fullerenes are a type of carbon allotrope, and PC70BM is a fullerene derivative that is commonly used as an electron transport material in organic photovoltaic cells. Therefore, "Polymer : PC 70 BM" can be considered as a "Property Name" entity representing a specific type of fullerene derivative.

6. Ca: Calcium is a chemical element with the symbol Ca and atomic number 20. It is a soft, silvery-white alkaline earth metal. In the context of solar cells, calcium is often used as a dopant to improve the performance of the perovskite layer. Therefore, "Ca" can be considered as a "Property Name" entity representing a specific type of dopant material.

7. Al: Aluminum is a chemical element with the symbol Al and atomic number 13. It is a silvery-white, soft, non-magnetic, ductile metal. In the context of solar cells, aluminum is often used as a back contact material. Therefore, "Al" can be considered as a "Property Name" entity representing a specific type of metal used as a back contact material.
Please remove irrelevant entities and only keep the entities that clearly refer to Material Property.

1. PDTP-BT, PDTP-DTBT, PDTP-DT2BT: These are the names of the copolymers with specific photovoltaic properties.
2. PC 70 BM: This is a fullerene derivative used as an electron transport material in organic photovoltaic cells.

Therefore, the relevant "Property Name" entities in the paragraph are: PDTP-BT, PDTP-DTBT, PDTP-DT2BT, and PC 70 BM.

Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Property Name".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

| Property Name |
| --- |
| PDTP-BT |
| PDTP-DTBT |
| PDTP-DT2BT |
| PC 70 BM |

PV.content:
Please identify the "Property Value" entities in the following paragraph.

Paragraph: The photovoltaic properties of the three copolymers PDTP-BT , PDTP - DTBT and PDTP-DT2BT were studied by fabricating bulk heterojunction BHJ - type PSCs with a conventional sandwich configuration of ITO / PEDOT : PSS / polymer : PC 70 BM / Ca / Al.

Let's think step by step.

1. PDTP-BT, PDTP-DTBT, PDTP-DT2BT: These are copolymers with specific names. In the context of the paragraph, they can be considered as "Property Value" entities as they have unique photovoltaic properties that are being studied.
2. BHJ - type PSCs: This is a type of Photovoltaic Solar Cells (PSCs) with Bulk Heterojunction (BHJ) configuration. It can be considered as a "Property Value" entity as it is a specific type of solar cell with a particular configuration.
3. ITO: Indium Tin Oxide, a conductive material used as an electrode in the solar cell. It can be considered as a "Property Value" entity as it has specific electrical conductivity properties.
4. PEDOT : PSS: Poly(3,4-ethylenedioxythiophene):poly(styrenesulfonate), a conducting polymer used as a hole transport layer in the solar cell. It can be considered as a "Property Value" entity as it has specific electrical conductivity and hole transport properties.
5. Polymer: This could refer to any of the three copolymers (PDTP-BT, PDTP-DTBT, PDTP-DT2BT) used in the solar cell. It can be considered as a "Property Value" entity as it has specific photovoltaic properties.
6. PC 70 BM: Poly(3-hexylthiophene-2,5-diyl-alt-[2-(2'-methoxyethyl)-5-(2-ethylhexyl)-1,4-phenylene]-alt-[2,5-bis(trifluoromethyl)phenylene]-1,1-dioxide), a fullerene derivative used as an electron transport layer in the solar cell. It can be considered as a "Property Value" entity as it has specific electrical conductivity and electron transport properties.
7. Ca: Calcium, a metal used as a buffer layer in the solar cell. It can be considered as a "Property Value" entity as it has specific chemical and physical properties.
8. Al: Aluminum, a metal used as a back contact in the solar cell. It can be considered as a "Property Value" entity as it has specific electrical conductivity properties.
Please remove irrelevant entities and only keep the entities that clearly refer to Value of Material Property.

1. PDTP-BT, PDTP-DTBT, PDTP-DT2BT: These are copolymers with specific names and unique photovoltaic properties.
2. Polymer: Specific copolymers used in the solar cell with photovoltaic properties.
3. PC 70 BM: A fullerene derivative used as an electron transport layer in the solar cell with specific electrical conductivity and electron transport properties.

These entities are the most relevant as they are explicitly mentioned as having specific material properties that are being studied in the context of the paragraph.

Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Property Value".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

| Property Value |
| --- |
| PDTP-BT, PDTP-DTBT, PDTP-DT2BT |
| Specific copolymers used in the solar cell |
| PC 70 BM |

These entities are the most relevant as they are explicitly mentioned as having specific material properties that are being studied in the context of the paragraph.
